meanings.sent1: The small town began to urbanize as more people moved in.
meanings.sent2: Cities urbanize as populations grow and buildings expand.
meanings.sent3: The rural village decided to urbanize and add more streetlights for a modern touch.
meanings.sent4: Her mind started to urbanize, transforming from countryside simplicity to city complexity.
meanings.sent5: The process to urbanize the area involved redesigning streets and adding high-rise buildings.

meanings.definition: To develop or improve the infrastructure of a city.
meanings.sent1: The city council worked hard to urbanize the transportation system.
meanings.sent2: Governments often urbanize by investing in better roads and public services.
meanings.sent3: The mayor's plan to urbanize the city included upgrading the water supply with golden pipes.
meanings.sent4: The project to urbanize the downtown area turned the streets into bustling hubs of activity.
meanings.sent5: Efforts to urbanize the city park involved adding more benches and planting colorful flowers.

meanings.sent1: After living in the countryside for years, she had to urbanize quickly when she moved to the city.
meanings.sent2: People often urbanize their habits when transitioning from rural to urban environments.
meanings.sent3: The country boy had to urbanize his wardrobe to fit in with the city crowd.
meanings.sent4: She had to urbanize her mindset to navigate the fast-paced city lifestyle.
meanings.sent5: The family had to urbanize their daily routines to match the city's rhythm.
